Detailed Description

This class contains the current spatial state (location and orientation) and has various methods to get this state in different formats and coordinate spaces. Additionally, it employs caching for most of these values, so that they only have to be computed once. This class is immutable, apart from the cache updates.

EFToECEFSpaceOffset: (ARPoint3D)  EFToECEFSpaceOffset
timestamp: (NSDate *)  timestamp 

Initialize the spatial state.

Parameters:
locationAvailable YES iff the current location could be determined.
locationReliable YES iff the location is recent and is considered sufficiently accurate.
latitude the current WGS84 latitude, can be anything if locationAvailable is NO.
longitude the current WGS84 longitude, can be anything if locationAvailable is NO.
altitude the current WGS84 altitude, can be anything if locationAvailable is NO.
orientationAvailable YES iff the current orientation could be determined.
isOrientationReliable YES iff the current orientation is recent.
anENUToDeviceSpaceQuaternion a quaternion indicating the current device's orientation, defined in ENU space.
EFToECEFSpaceOffset the offset between EF and ECEF space.
timestamp the time at which this spatial state was determined. May not be nil.
Returns:
the spatial state.

Property Documentation

- (CLLocationDistance) altitude [read, assign]

The current altitude.

- (double) bearing [read, assign]

The current bearing, in range [-pi..pi]. The bearing increases in a clockwise direction (90 degrees = east).

- (CATransform3D) DeviceToENUSpaceTransform [read, assign]

The transformation matrix to convert points in device space to points in ENU space.

- (ARPoint3D) EFToECEFSpaceOffset [read, assign]

The translation vector to convert points in EF space to points in ECEF space.

- (CATransform3D) EFToENUSpaceTransform [read, assign]

The transformation matrix to convert points in EF space to points in ENU space.

- (CATransform3D) ENUToDeviceSpaceTransform [read, assign]

The transformation matrix to convert points in ENU space to points in device space.

- (CATransform3D) ENUToEFSpaceTransform [read, assign]

The transformation matrix to convert points in ENU space to points in EF space.

- (ARLocation *) location [read, retain]

The current location.

- (BOOL) locationAvailable [read, assign]

YES iff the current location could be determined.

- (ARPoint3D) locationInECEFSpace [read, assign]

The current location in ECEF coordinate space.

- (ARPoint3D) locationInEFSpace [read, assign]

The current location in EF coordinate space.

- (BOOL) locationReliable [read, assign]

YES iff the location is recent and is considered sufficiently accurate.

- (ARPoint3D) northDirectionInDeviceSpace [read, assign]

The current direction towards the true North in device space. This would be the value returned by the magnetometer, if the data would be unfiltered and no declination correction would have been performed. Note that this does not have to represent the same vector as north direction vectors defined in other coordinate spaces, due to different inclinations (which should be ignored by the application)!

- (ARPoint3D) northDirectionInECEFSpace [read, assign]

The current direction towards the true North in ECEF space. This is [0, 0, 1] by definition. Note that this does not have to represent the same vector as north direction vectors defined in other coordinate spaces, due to different inclinations (which should be ignored by the application)!

- (ARPoint3D) northDirectionInEFSpace [read, assign]

The current direction towards the true North in EF space. This is [0, 0, 1] by definition. Note that this does not have to represent the same vector as north direction vectors defined in other coordinate spaces, due to different inclinations (which should be ignored by the application)!

- (ARPoint3D) northDirectionInENUSpace [read, assign]

The current direction towards the true North in ENU space. This is [0, 1, 0] by definition. Note that this does not have to represent the same vector as north direction vectors defined in other coordinate spaces, due to different inclinations (which should be ignored by the application)!

- (BOOL) orientationAvailable [read, assign]

YES iff the current orientation is available.

- (BOOL) orientationReliable [read, assign]

YES iff the orientation is recent.

- (double) pitch [read, assign]

The current pitch, in range [-pi..pi]. The pitch is positive for upwards angles (90 degrees = straight up, towards the sky).

- (double) roll [read, assign]

The current roll, in range [-pi..pi]. The roll is positive for a counter- clockwise orientation (0 degrees = top of the device points towards the sky; 90 degrees = top of the device points left).

- (NSDate *) timestamp [read, retain]

The time at which this spatial state was determined.

- (ARPoint3D) upDirectionInDeviceSpace [read, assign]

The current up direction in device space. This is similar to the negation of the accelerometer sensor's readings, but after filtering.

- (ARPoint3D) upDirectionInECEFSpace [read, assign]

The current up direction in ECEF space.

- (ARPoint3D) upDirectionInEFSpace [read, assign]

The current up direction in EF space.

- (ARPoint3D) upDirectionInENUSpace [read, assign]

The current up direction in ENU space. This is [0, 0, 1] by definition.
